title: AB 2676
content: Section 17052.6 of the Revenue and Taxation Code in California is amended to allow a credit against net tax for expenses related to household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment. The credit amount is determined based on the Internal Revenue Code and is a percentage of the allowable federal credit without considering federal tax liability. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of credit for household and dependent care services in California. Different income brackets have varying credit percentages, with higher incomes receiving lower or no credit. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of credit for household and dependent care services in California. Income brackets dictate credit percentages: $40,000 or less - 65%, over $40,000 but not over $70,000 - 50%, over $70,000 but not over $100,000 - 34%, over $100,000 - 0%. For taxable years starting January 1, 2019. Adjusted gross income determines the percentage of credit for household and dependent care services in California. The credit percentages are as follows: $40,000 or less - 50%, over $40,000 but not over $70,000 - 43%, over $70,000 but not over $100,000 - 34%, over $100,000 - 0%. The credit is limited to expenses for household services and care provided in the state. Earned income for armed forces members is considered taxable income in California. The definition of a qualifying individual for tax purposes is expanded to include children as defined in the Internal Revenue Code. For tax purposes, a child shall be considered a qualifying individual if they receive over half of their support from the parent with custody for the majority of the year. This parent is then classified as the "custodial parent" under the Internal Revenue Code. The child must receive over half of their support from parents who never married and lived apart during the last six months of the year. The child must also be in the custody of one or both parents for more than half of the year. Amendments to this section apply to taxable years starting in 2002 and 2011. This act enacts a tax levy and takes immediate effect.
